summary.span: Controls the system garbage collector, a service that automatically reclaims unused memory.

span.span: Controls the system garbage collector, a service that automatically reclaims unused memory.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 記憶體回收行程是控制項的配置和釋放的 managed 記憶體的通用語言執行階段元件。The garbage collector is a common language runtime component that controls the allocation and release of managed memory. 物件和釋放物件所配置的資源時執行記憶體回收時，就會影響此類別中的方法。The methods in this class influence when garbage collection is performed on an object and when resources allocated by an object are released. 此類別中的屬性系統的年齡類別目錄或產生，配置給物件的記憶體中提供可用的記憶體總數量的相關資訊。Properties in this class provide information about the total amount of memory available in the system and the age category, or generation, of memory allocated to an object. 記憶體回收行程會追蹤，而且會回收配置於 managed 記憶體中的物件。The garbage collector tracks and reclaims objects allocated in managed memory. 定期記憶體回收行程執行記憶體回收回收記憶體配置給物件的有無有效的參考。Periodically, the garbage collector performs garbage collection to reclaim memory allocated to objects for which there are no valid references. 使用可用記憶體無法滿足記憶體要求時，會自動發生記憶體回收。Garbage collection happens automatically when a request for memory cannot be satisfied using available free memory. 或者，應用程式可以強制記憶體回收集合使用方法。Alternatively, an application can force garbage collection using the method. 記憶體回收包含下列步驟：Garbage collection consists of the following steps: 1. 記憶體回收行程會搜尋在 managed 程式碼所參考的 managed 物件。The garbage collector searches for managed objects that are referenced in managed code. 2. 記憶體回收行程會嘗試完成未參考的物件。The garbage collector tries to finalize objects that are not referenced. 3. 記憶體回收行程釋放未參考的物件，並會回收記憶體。The garbage collector frees objects that are not referenced and reclaims their memory. 本主題包含下列章節：This topic includes the following sections: [記憶體回收行程和 unmanaged 的資源](#unmanaged) [The garbage collector and unmanaged resources](#unmanaged) [物件的過時和層代](#generations) [Object aging and generations](#generations) [不允許記憶體回收Disallowing garbage collection](#NoGCRegion) ## 記憶體回收行程和 unmanaged 的資源The garbage collector and unmanaged resources 在回收期間，記憶體回收行程不會釋放物件如果 managed 程式碼中發現一個或多個物件的參考。During a collection, the garbage collector will not free an object if it finds one or more references to the object in managed code. 不過，記憶體回收行程無法辨識從 unmanaged 程式碼中，物件的參考，而且可能釋放物件，除非明確地防止這樣使用 unmanaged 程式碼中以獨佔方式。However, the garbage collector does not recognize references to an object from unmanaged code, and might free objects that are being used exclusively in unmanaged code unless explicitly prevented from doing so. 方法提供一套機制，可以防止記憶體回收行程收集的物件仍在使用 unmanaged 程式碼中。The method provides a mechanism that prevents the garbage collector from collecting objects that are still in use in unmanaged code. 除了 managed 的記憶體配置的記憶體回收行程實作不會維護的物件，例如檔案控制代碼或資料庫連接所持有的資源的相關資訊。Aside from managed memory allocations, implementations of the garbage collector do not maintain information about resources held by an object, such as file handles or database connections. 當型別使用的 unmanaged 的資源，必須釋放回收的類型執行個體之前時，類型可以實作完成項。When a type uses unmanaged resources that must be released before instances of the type are reclaimed, the type can implement a finalizer. 在大部分情況下，完成項會實作覆寫方法; 不過，撰寫 C# 或 c + + 中的類型實作解構函式的編譯器將轉換的覆寫成。In most cases, finalizers are implemented by overriding the method; however, types written in C# or C++ implement destructors, which compilers turn into an override of . 在大部分情況下，如果物件具有完成項中，記憶體回收行程呼叫它之前釋出物件。In most cases, if an object has a finalizer, the garbage collector calls it prior to freeing the object. 不過，記憶體回收行程不需要在所有情況下，呼叫完成項例如，方法明確地防止物件的完成項呼叫。However, the garbage collector is not required to call finalizers in all situations; for example, the method explicitly prevents an object's finalizer from being called. 此外，記憶體回收行程不需要使用特定的執行緒，以便最終處理物件，保證彼此參考，但可進行記憶體回收的物件呼叫完成項的順序。Also, the garbage collector is not required to use a specific thread to finalize objects, or guarantee the order in which finalizers are called for objects that reference each other but are otherwise available for garbage collection. 在特定時間必須釋放資源的情況下，類別可以實作介面，其中包含方法，執行資源管理和清除工作。In scenarios where resources must be released at a specific time, classes can implement the interface, which contains the method that performs resource management and cleanup tasks. 類別可實作必須指定，做為其類別合約的一部分時類別取用者呼叫方法，以清除物件。Classes that implement must specify, as part of their class contract, if and when class consumers call the method to clean up the object. 記憶體回收行程不會根據預設，呼叫方法; 不過，實作方法可以呼叫方法中類別來自訂記憶體回收行程的最終處理行為。The garbage collector does not, by default, call the method; however, implementations of the method can call methods in the class to customize the finalization behavior of the garbage collector. 如需有關物件最終處理和 dispose 模式的詳細資訊，請參閱[清除 Unmanaged 資源上](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md)。For more information on object finalization and the dispose pattern, see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md). ## 物件的過時和層代Object aging and generations Common language runtime 在記憶體回收行程支援物件使用的層代的時效性。The garbage collector in the common language runtime supports object aging using generations. 層代是測量的記憶體中物件的相對存在時間單位。A generation is a unit of measure of the relative age of objects in memory. 層代編號或年齡物件表示物件所屬的層代。The generation number, or age, of an object indicates the generation to which an object belongs. 建立多個物件最近是較新的層代的一部分，而且具有小於物件先前在應用程式生命週期的層代編號。Objects created more recently are part of newer generations, and have lower generation numbers than objects created earlier in the application life cycle. 層代 0 中，是最新的層代中的物件。Objects in the most recent generation are in generation 0. 記憶體回收行程的這項實作支援三個層代的物件，這些層代 0、 1 和 2。This implementation of the garbage collector supports three generations of objects, generations 0, 1, and 2. 您可以擷取的值屬性，以判斷系統所支援的最大層代編號。You can retrieve the value of the property to determine the maximum generation number supported by the system. 物件的時效性允許目標回收應用程式，在一組特定的層代，而不是需要評估所有層代記憶體回收行程。Object aging allows applications to target garbage collection at a specific set of generations rather than requiring the garbage collector to evaluate all generations. 多載方法包含`generation`參數可讓您指定要進行記憶體回收的最舊層代。Overloads of the method that include a `generation` parameter allow you to specify the oldest generation to be garbage collected. ## 不允許記憶體回收Disallowing garbage collection 從開始[!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)]，記憶體回收行程支援無 GC 區域延遲模式，可以在記憶體回收的集合可以有負面影響的應用程式效能的關鍵路徑的執行期間使用。Starting with the [!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)], the garbage collector supports a no GC region latency mode that can be used during the execution of critical paths in which garbage collection can adversely affect an app's performance. 無 GC 區域延遲模式需要您指定可從記憶體回收行程配置不受干擾的記憶體數量。The no GC region latency mode requires that you specify an amount of memory that can be allocated without interference from the garbage collector. 如果執行階段可以配置的記憶體，執行階段不會執行回收時執行的關鍵路徑中的程式碼。If the runtime can allocate that memory, the runtime will not perform a garbage collection while code in the critical path is executing. 您透過呼叫其中一個多載定義的無 GC 區域的關鍵路徑的開頭。You define the beginning of the critical path of the no GC region by calling one of the overloads of the . 您可以指定其關鍵路徑的結尾呼叫方法。You specify the end of its critical path by calling the method. 您無法巢狀呼叫方法，而且您應該只呼叫方法，如果執行階段目前處於無 GC 區域延遲模式。You cannot nest calls to the method, and you should only call the method if the runtime is currently in no GC region latency mode. 換句話說，您不應該呼叫多次 （第一個方法呼叫之後，後續呼叫將不會成功），和不應呼叫才會成功，因為第一次呼叫成功。In other words, you should not call multiple times (after the first method call, subsequent calls will not succeed), and you should not expect calls to to succeed just because the first call to succeeded. ## Examples 下列範例會使用數個 GC 方法，以取得產生和記憶體未使用物件的區塊資訊並列印到主控台。The following example uses several GC methods to get generation and memory information about a block of unused objects and print it to the console. 然後會回收未使用的物件，而且會顯示產生的記憶體總數。The unused objects are then collected, and the resulting memory totals are displayed. [!code-cpp[System.GC.Collect Int Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.gc.collect int example/CPP/class1.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.GC.Collect Int Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.gc.collect int example/CS/class1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.GC.Collect Int Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.gc.collect int example/VB/class1.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在決定何時要排定記憶體回收時，執行階段會考量已配置的受管理的記憶體。In determining when to schedule garbage collection, the runtime takes into account how much managed memory is allocated. 如果小型的 managed 的物件會配置大量的未受管理的記憶體，執行階段會考量只有受管理的記憶體，並因此低估排定記憶體回收的急迫性。If a small managed object allocates a large amount of unmanaged memory, the runtime takes into account only the managed memory, and thus underestimates the urgency of scheduling garbage collection. 方法告知執行階段，此額外系統記憶體不足。The method informs the runtime of this additional pressure on system memory. 在最簡單的使用方式模式中，受管理的物件配置 unmanaged 的記憶體中的建構函式，並釋放它在`Dispose`或`Finalize`方法。In the simplest usage pattern, a managed object allocates unmanaged memory in the constructor and releases it in the `Dispose` or `Finalize` method. 呼叫方法之後配置 unmanaged 的記憶體中，並呼叫之後釋出它的方法。Call the method after allocating the unmanaged memory, and call the method after releasing it. 在更複雜的情況，其中 unmanaged 的記憶體配置的 managed 物件的存留期間變更本質上，您可以呼叫和通訊這些執行階段的累加變更的方法。In more complicated scenarios, where the unmanaged memory allocation changes substantially during the lifetime of the managed object, you can call the and methods to communicate these incremental changes to the runtime. > [!CAUTION] > 您必須確定您移除完全壓力您新增的數量。You must ensure that you remove exactly the amount of pressure you add. 不這樣做的話，可能會影響系統的長時間執行的應用程式的效能。Failing to do so can adversely affect the performance of the system in applications that run for long periods of time.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用這個方法，嘗試回收所有無法存取的記憶體。Use this method to try to reclaim all memory that is inaccessible. 它會執行所有層代的封鎖記憶體回收。It performs a blocking garbage collection of all generations. 所有的物件，不論多久已在記憶體中，會被視為集合;不過，不會收集 managed 程式碼中所參考的物件。All objects, regardless of how long they have been in memory, are considered for collection; however, objects that are referenced in managed code are not collected. 使用這個方法來強制系統嘗試回收的最大可用記憶體數量。Use this method to force the system to try to reclaim the maximum amount of available memory. 從開始[!INCLUDE[net_v451](~/includes/net-v451-md.md)]，您可以藉由設定壓縮大型物件堆積 (LOH)屬性之前先呼叫方法，如下列範例會說明。Starting with the [!INCLUDE[net_v451](~/includes/net-v451-md.md)], you can compact the large object heap (LOH) by setting the property to before calling the method, as the following example illustrates. [!code-csharp[System.Runtime.GCSettings#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.runtime.gcsettings/cs/lohcompactionmode1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Runtime.GCSettings#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.runtime.gcsettings/vb/lohcompactionmode1.vb#1)] ## Examples 下列範例示範如何使用方法執行所有層代的記憶體回收。The following example demonstrates how to use the method to perform a collection on all generations of memory. 程式碼會產生未使用的物件數目，然後呼叫方法來從記憶體清除它們。The code generates a number of unused objects, and then calls the method to clean them from memory. [!code-cpp[System.GC.Collect Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.GC.Collect Example/CPP/class1.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.GC.Collect Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.GC.Collect Example/CS/class1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.GC.Collect Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.GC.Collect Example/VB/class1.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 再試一次回收記憶體而無法使用這個方法。Use this method to try to reclaim memory that is inaccessible. 不過，使用此方法不保證會回收所有存取的記憶體中指定的層代。However, using this method does not guarantee that all inaccessible memory in the specified generation is reclaimed. 如果物件的時效性實作時，記憶體回收行程無法回收物件以產生數字高於指定層代。If object aging is implemented, the garbage collector does not collect objects with a generation number that is higher than the specified generation. 未實作物件的時效性，如果記憶體回收行程會考慮在記憶體回收期間的所有物件。If object aging is not implemented, the garbage collector considers all objects during the garbage collection. 使用屬性來判斷最大有效值`generation`參數。Use the property to determine the maximum valid value of the `generation` parameter. 若要考慮所有的物件，不論其層代記憶體回收行程，請使用這個方法不採用參數的版本。To have the garbage collector consider all objects regardless of their generation, use the version of this method that takes no parameters. 若要將記憶體回收行程回收物件根據設定，請使用方法多載。To have the garbage collector reclaim objects based on a setting, use the method overload. ## Examples 下列範例示範如何使用執行回收的記憶體的個別圖層上的方法。The following example demonstrates how to use the method to perform a collection on individual layers of memory. 程式碼會產生未使用的物件數目，然後呼叫方法來從記憶體清除它們。The code generates a number of unused objects, and then calls the method to clean them from memory. [!code-cpp[System.GC.Collect Int Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.gc.collect int example/CPP/class1.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.GC.Collect Int Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.gc.collect int example/CS/class1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.GC.Collect Int Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.gc.collect int example/VB/class1.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用`mode`參數來指定是否應該發生記憶體回收立即] 或 [僅時間是否最佳回收物件。Use the `mode` parameter to specify whether garbage collection should occur immediately or only if the time is optimal to reclaim objects. 使用此方法不保證會回收所有存取的記憶體中指定的層代。Using this method does not guarantee that all inaccessible memory in the specified generation is reclaimed. 若要調整應用程式中的重大期間記憶體回收的干擾程度，請設定屬性。To adjust the intrusiveness of garbage collection during critical periods in your application, set the property. 記憶體回收行程不會收集以產生數字高於所指定的物件`generation`參數。The garbage collector does not collect objects with a generation number higher than specified by the `generation` parameter. 使用屬性來判斷最大有效值`generation`。Use the property to determine the maximum valid value of `generation`. 若要考慮所有的物件，不論其層代記憶體回收行程，請使用這個方法不採用參數的版本。To have the garbage collector consider all objects regardless of their generation, use the version of this method that takes no parameters. 若要讓記憶體回收行程回收最多指定物件層代的物件，請使用方法多載。To have the garbage collector reclaim objects up to a specified generation of objects, use the method overload. 當您指定最大層代時，則會收集所有物件。When you specify the maximum generation, all objects are collected. ## Examples 下列範例強制執行記憶體回收層代 2 物件設定。The following example forces a garbage collection for generation 2 objects with the setting. remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果`blocking`是`false`，GC 會決定是否要執行的背景或封鎖記憶體回收。If `blocking` is `false`, the GC decides whether to perform a background or a blocking garbage collection. 如果`compacting`是`true`，它會執行封鎖記憶體回收。If `compacting` is `true`, it performs a blocking garbage collection. 如果`compacting`是`true`，執行階段會壓縮小型物件堆積 (SOH)。If `compacting` is `true`, the runtime compacts the small object heap (SOH). 除非，不會壓縮大型物件堆積 (LOH)屬性設定為。The large object heap (LOH) is not compacted unless the property is set to . 請注意，這包含所有封鎖記憶體回收，不只完整封鎖記憶體回收。Note that this includes all blocking garbage collections, not just full blocking garbage collections. 您可以呼叫方法，以減少受管理的堆積大小最小，如下列程式碼片段所示。You can call the method to reduce the managed heap to the smallest size possible, as the following code fragment illustrates. [!code-csharp[System.GC.Collect#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.gc.collect/cs/collect4.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.GC.Collect#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.gc.collect/vb/collect4.vb#1)] 指定`true`如`compacting`引數可保證壓縮、 完整封鎖記憶體回收。Specifying `true` for the `compacting` argument guarantees a compacting, full blocking garbage collection. 設定屬性可確保會壓縮 LOH 與 SOH。Setting the property to ensures that both the LOH and SOH are compacted.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 目的方法是確保可能過早被記憶體回收行程回收物件的參考是否存在。The purpose of the method is to ensure the existence of a reference to an object that is at risk of being prematurely reclaimed by the garbage collector. 這其中可能會發生的常見案例是當沒有物件參考 managed 程式碼或資料，但物件仍在使用 unmanaged 程式碼，例如 Win32 Api，unmanaged Dll，或使用 COM 方法A common scenario where this might happen is when there are no references to the object in managed code or data, but the object is still in use in unmanaged code such as Win32 APIs, unmanaged DLLs, or methods using COM. 這個方法所參考`obj`參數，使該物件適合記憶體回收從常式的開始點，以執行順序，會呼叫這個方法。This method references the `obj` parameter, making that object ineligible for garbage collection from the start of the routine to the point, in execution order, where this method is called. 這個方法在結束時，無法開始時，指示的範圍的程式碼位置`obj`必須可供使用。Code this method at the end, not the beginning, of the range of instructions where `obj` must be available. 方法會執行任何作業，並產生沒有副作用以外延伸做為參數傳遞的物件的存留期。The method performs no operation and produces no side effects other than extending the lifetime of the object passed in as a parameter. ## Examples 下列程式碼範例會建立物件的開頭其`Main`方法，而且不會一次，直到結束時，無法參考物件時方法呼叫。The following code example creates an object at the beginning of its `Main` method and does not refer to the object again until the end, when the method is called. 30 秒期間的物件保存`Main`方法，儘管呼叫和方法。The object persists for the 30-second duration of the `Main` method, despite calls to the and methods. remarks.format: ## Remarks 層代編號或年齡，物件會實作定義相對量值物件的使用期限。The generation number, or age, of an object is an implementation-defined relative measure of an object's lifespan. 最新建立的物件是層代 0 中，最舊的物件是小於或等於產生傳回的層代屬性。The most recently created objects are in generation 0 and the oldest objects are in a generation less than or equal to the generation returned by the property. 記憶體回收行程會假設較新的記憶體是比較可能是較舊的記憶體回收。The garbage collector assumes that newer memory is more likely to be eligible for garbage collection than older memory. 因此，記憶體回收行程會改善其效能調整它會回收記憶體，每次產生數字和屬性值可以隨著時間成長。Therefore, the garbage collector improves its performance by adjusting generation numbers each time it reclaims memory, and the property value can grow over time. 如果實作物件的時效性，屬性會傳回系統所使用的最大層代編號，否則這個屬性會傳回零。If object aging is implemented, the property returns the maximum generation number used by the system; otherwise, this property returns zero. ## Examples 下列範例會示範如何使用 MaxGeneration 屬性來使用目前顯示的最大層代編號。The following example demonstrates how to use the MaxGeneration property to display the largest generation number currently in use. [!code-cpp[System.GC.Collect Int Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.gc.collect int example/CPP/class1.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.GC.Collect Int Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.gc.collect int example/CS/class1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.GC.Collect Int Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.gc.collect int example/VB/class1.vb#1)]

span.para: 此實作中，傳回的值由屬性會保證執行的應用程式的存留期間保持不變。使用屬性來判斷呼叫時，您可以指定的最大值採用產生參數的方法。

For this implementation, the value returned by the property is guaranteed to remain constant for the lifetime of an executing application. Use the property to determine the maximum value you can specify when calling the method that takes a generation parameter.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 針對每個層代中，記憶體回收行程會設定成該層代的配置臨界值。For each generation, the garbage collector sets a threshold for allocations into that generation. 當配置的記憶體大小超過此臨界值時，該層代上觸發記憶體回收。When the size of allocations exceeds this threshold, a garbage collection is triggered on that generation. 如範例中，如果層代 2 的臨界值是 20 MB （亦即未層代 1 回收 20 MB，並提升至層代 2），超過 20 MB 尚未被第 1 代，而且會提示輸入至層代 2 中，將會嘗試下一個記憶體回收為層代 2 回收。For example, if generation 2’s threshold is 20MB (which means that 20MB survives generation 1 collections and is promoted into generation 2), and more than 20MB has survived generation 1 and is prompted into generation 2, the next garbage collection will be attempted as a generation 2 collection. 同樣地，如果大型物件堆積 (LOH) 臨界值是 20 MB，您的應用程式有已配置超過 20 MB 的大型物件下, 一個記憶體回收也會嘗試為層代 2 回收 （因為，gen2 記憶體回收中才會收集 LOH）。Similarly, if the large object heap's (LOH's) threshold is 20MB and your app has allocated more than 20MB of large objects, the next garbage collection will also be attempted as a generation 2 collection (since the LOH is only collected in gen2 garbage collections). `maxGenerationThreshold`和`largeObjectHeapThreshold`臨界值會控制多少事先通知您完整記憶體回收發生之前。The `maxGenerationThreshold` and `largeObjectHeapThreshold` thresholds control how much in advance you are notified before a full garbage collection occurs. 閾值愈通知和下一個完整記憶體回收之間可能的多個配置。The greater the threshold, the more allocations that can occur between notification and the next full garbage collection. 如果您在其中完整回收，common language runtime 會影響您的應用程式效能的情況下，您可以要求執行完整記憶體回收和規避該集合，由執行階段時收到通知自行引發集合 (使用方法) 時仍理想狀況。If you have situations in which a full garbage collection by the common language runtime would adversely affect your application's performance, you can ask to be notified when the runtime is about to do a full garbage collection and circumvent that collection by inducing a collection yourself (using the method) when conditions are still favorable. 除了變更自己的記憶體回收集合排程，完整 GC 通知適用於下列案例：In addition to changing the garbage collection schedule yourself, full GC notification is useful in following the scenarios: - 您進行監視的完整記憶體回收的方法，當系統通知您其中一個已接近，您縮小即時資料 （例如，藉由釋放某些快取項目）。You monitor for the approach of a full garbage collection and, when you are notified that one is approaching, you reduce live data size (for example, by releasing some cache entries). 如此一來，當記憶體回收發生時，便能將回收更多記憶體。As a result, when the garbage collection occurs, it is able to reclaim more memory. - 您監視的完整記憶體回收完成，而您可以收集一些統計資料。You monitor for the completion of a full garbage collection so that you can collect some statistics. 例如，您可以測量在 GC 完成堆積的大小，好讓您知道即時資料的大小。For example, you might want to measure the size of the heap at GC completion so that you know the size of live data. （完整的 GC，堆積之後的最小大小。）(After a full GC, the heap is at its smallest size.) 如需有關什麼代表完整記憶體回收的詳細資訊，請參閱[記憶體回收通知](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/notifications.md)。For more information about what represents a full garbage collection, see [Garbage Collection Notifications](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/notifications.md). 當您註冊記憶體回收通知時，接近完整記憶體回收時和完成時，則會通知您可以。When you register for a garbage collection notification, you can be notified when a full garbage collection is approaching and when it is completed. 此模式類似於如何作業系統用來監視記憶體不足的通知。This pattern resembles how the operating system monitors for low memory notifications. 使用下列指導方針來指定`maxGenerationThreshold`和`largeObjectHeapThreshold`參數：Use the following guidelines for specifying the `maxGenerationThreshold` and `largeObjectHeapThreshold` parameters: - 臨界值越大，更多的配置會通知與完整記憶體回收之間發生。The larger the threshold value, the more allocations will occur between the notification and the full garbage collection. 較大的臨界值會提供更多的機會，為了讓執行階段檢查接近的集合。A larger threshold value provides more opportunities for the runtime to check for an approaching collection. 這會增加，系統會通知您的可能性。This increases the likelihood that you will be notified. 不過，您不應該設定過高臨界值，因為這樣會造成更多的配置之前執行階段產生的下一個集合。However, you should not set the threshold too high because that results in a more allocations before the runtime induces the next collection. 當您自行引發回收告知使用高臨界值時，會由執行階段的下一次回收收回比回收較少的物件。When you induce a collection yourself upon notification using a high threshold value, fewer objects are reclaimed than would be reclaimed by the runtime's next collection. - 小臨界值，較少通知與完整記憶體回收之間配置。The smaller the threshold value, the fewer the allocations between notification and the full garbage collection. ## Examples 下列範例會示範如何註冊記憶體回收通知並啟動執行緒來監視記憶體回收通知的狀態。The following example shows how to register a garbage collection notification and start a thread to monitor the status of the garbage collection notification. 這個程式碼範例是針對所提供之較大範例的一部分[記憶體回收通知](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/notifications.md)主題。This code example is part of a larger example provided for [Garbage Collection Notifications](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/notifications.md) topic. remarks.format: ## Remarks 在決定何時要排定記憶體回收時，執行階段會考量已配置的受管理的記憶體。In determining when to schedule garbage collection, the runtime takes into account how much managed memory is allocated. 如果小型的 managed 的物件會配置大量的未受管理的記憶體，執行階段會考量只有受管理的記憶體，並因此低估排定記憶體回收的急迫性。If a small managed object allocates a large amount of unmanaged memory, the runtime takes into account only the managed memory, and thus underestimates the urgency of scheduling garbage collection. 方法告知執行階段，系統記憶體，此額外的壓力而方法會通知執行階段已釋放額外的壓力。The method informs the runtime of this additional pressure on system memory, and the method informs the runtime that the additional pressure has been released. 在最簡單的使用方式模式中，受管理的物件配置 unmanaged 的記憶體中的建構函式，並釋放它在`Dispose`或`Finalize`方法。In the simplest usage pattern, a managed object allocates unmanaged memory in the constructor and releases it in the `Dispose` or `Finalize` method. 呼叫方法之後配置 unmanaged 的記憶體中，並呼叫之後釋出它的方法。Call the method after allocating the unmanaged memory, and call the method after releasing it. 在更複雜的情況，其中 unmanaged 的記憶體配置的 managed 物件的存留期間變更本質上，您可以呼叫和通訊這些執行階段的累加變更的方法。In more complicated scenarios, where the unmanaged memory allocation changes substantially during the lifetime of the managed object, you can call the and methods to communicate these incremental changes to the runtime. > [!CAUTION] > 您必須確定您移除完全壓力您新增的數量。You must ensure that you remove exactly the amount of pressure you add. 不這樣做的話，可能會影響系統的長時間執行的應用程式的效能。Failing to do so can adversely affect the performance of the system in applications that run for long periods of time.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法會將`obj`參數的記憶體回收行程釋放物件之前，要求最終處理的物件清單。The method adds the `obj` parameter to the list of objects that request finalization before the garbage collector frees the object. `obj`參數必須是這個方法的呼叫端。The `obj` parameter must be the caller of this method. 呼叫方法不保證記憶體回收行程會呼叫物件的完成項。Calling the method does not guarantee that the garbage collector will call an object's finalizer. 根據預設，會實作完成項的所有物件都加入至所需的最終處理; 的物件清單不過，物件可能已完成，或可能已停用最終處理藉由呼叫方法。By default, all objects that implement finalizers are added to the list of objects that require finalization; however, an object might have already been finalized or might have disabled finalization by calling the method. 完成項可以使用這個方法重新恢復它本身或它所參考的物件。A finalizer can use this method to resurrect itself or an object that it references. ## Examples 下列範例示範如何使用 ReRegisterForFinalize 方法來完成第二個物件在回收之後的時間。The following example demonstrates how to use the ReRegisterForFinalize method to finalize an object a second time after garbage collection. remarks.format: ## Remarks 這個方法會設定位元的物件標頭中`obj`，當呼叫完成項，執行階段檢查。This method sets a bit in the object header of `obj`, which the runtime checks when calling finalizers. 完成項，它由方法，用於物件被記憶體回收前釋放 unmanaged 的資源。A finalizer, which is represented by the method, is used to release unmanaged resources before an object is garbage-collected. 如果`obj`沒有完成項中，呼叫方法沒有任何作用。If `obj` does not have a finalizer, the call to the method has no effect. 物件，實作介面可以呼叫這個方法的物件從實作，以防止記憶體回收行程呼叫上不需要的物件。Objects that implement the interface can call this method from the object's implementation to prevent the garbage collector from calling on an object that does not require it. 一般而言，這為了釋放已釋放的 unmanaged 的資源時，防止完成項實作。Typically, this is done to prevent the finalizer from releasing unmanaged resources that have already been freed by the implementation. ## Examples 下列範例示範如何使用中的資源類別，以避免多餘的記憶體回收集合時呼叫的方法。The following example demonstrates how to use the method in a resource class to prevent a redundant garbage collection from being called. 此範例會使用[處置模式](~/docs/standard/design-guidelines/dispose-pattern.md)同時釋放 managed 資源 (也就是物件，實作) 與 unmanaged 資源。The example uses the [dispose pattern](~/docs/standard/design-guidelines/dispose-pattern.md) to free both managed resources (that is, objects that implement ) and unmanaged resources. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法會嘗試將記憶體回收行程中不允許記憶體回收，而應用程式執行的程式碼的重要區域無 GC 區域延遲模式。The method attempts to place the garbage collector in no GC region latency mode, which disallows garbage collection while an app executes a critical region of code. 如果執行階段無法一開始配置要求的記憶體數量，記憶體回收行程會執行完全封鎖記憶體回收，嘗試釋放出額外的記憶體。If the runtime is unable to initially allocate the requested amount of memory, the garbage collector performs a full blocking garbage collection in an attempt to free additional memory. 記憶體回收行程進入無 GC 區域延遲模式，它是否能夠配置所需的數量的記憶體，在此情況下為實際 2 \*`totalSize`位元組 (它會嘗試配置`totalSize`小型物件堆積位元組和`totalSize`的位元組數大型物件堆積）。The garbage collector enters no GC region latency mode if it is able to allocate the required amount of memory, which in this case is actually 2 \* `totalSize` bytes (it attempts to allocate `totalSize` bytes for the small object heap and `totalSize` bytes for the large object heap). `totalSize` 必須要夠大，無法處理發生的關鍵路徑中的所有記憶體配置。`totalSize` must be large enough to handle all memory allocations that occur in the critical path. 這包括應用程式時，所配置，以及執行階段可讓應用程式的代表的配置。This includes allocations by the app, as well as allocations that the runtime makes on the app's behalf. > [!IMPORTANT] > 您無法巢狀呼叫方法，而且您應該只呼叫方法，如果執行階段目前處於無 GC 區域延遲模式。You cannot nest calls to the method, and you should only call the method if the runtime is currently in no GC region latency mode. 換句話說，您不應該呼叫多次 （第一個方法呼叫之後，後續呼叫將不會成功），和不應呼叫才會成功，因為第一次呼叫成功。In other words, you should not call multiple times (after the first method call, subsequent calls will not succeed), and you should not expect calls to to succeed just because the first call to succeeded. 您藉由呼叫結束無 GC 區域延遲模式方法。You exit the no GC region latency mode by calling the method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法會嘗試將記憶體回收行程中不允許記憶體回收，而應用程式執行的程式碼的重要區域無 GC 區域延遲模式。The method attempts to place the garbage collector in no GC region latency mode, which disallows garbage collection while an app executes a critical region of code. 如果執行階段是無法一開始配置要求的記憶體數量和`disallowFullBlockingGC`引數是`false`，記憶體回收行程執行完全封鎖記憶體回收，嘗試釋放出額外的記憶體; 否則配置失敗，而且方法會傳回`false`。If the runtime is unable to initially allocate the requested amount of memory and the `disallowFullBlockingGC` argument is `false`, the garbage collector performs a full blocking garbage collection in an attempt to free additional memory; otherwise, the allocation fails, and the method returns `false`. 記憶體回收行程進入無 GC 區域延遲模式，它是否能夠配置所需的數量的記憶體，在此情況下為實際 2 \* `totalSize` (它會嘗試配置`totalSize`針對小物件堆積和`totalSize`大型物件堆積）。The garbage collector enters no GC region latency mode if it is able to allocate the required amount of memory, which in this case is actually 2 \* `totalSize` (it attempts to allocate `totalSize` for the small object heap and `totalSize` for the large object heap). `totalSize` 必須要夠大，無法處理發生的關鍵路徑中的所有記憶體配置。`totalSize` must be large enough to handle all memory allocations that occur in the critical path. 這包括應用程式時，所配置，以及執行階段可讓應用程式的代表的配置。This includes allocations by the app, as well as allocations that the runtime makes on the app's behalf. 設定`disallowFullBlockingGC`至`true`為了避免完整的封鎖記憶體回收集合，如果沒有足夠的記憶體一開始是負載平衡案例中最為有用： 一個系統可以呼叫這個方法，並報告本身為準備好接受要求，如果它傳回`true`，而且如果它傳回，將要求重新導向至其他系統的負載平衡器`false`。Setting `disallowFullBlockingGC` to `true` to prevent a full blocking garbage collection if not enough memory is initially available is most useful in load balancing scenarios: one system can call this method and report itself as ready to accept requests if it returns `true`, and have the load balancer redirect requests to other systems if it returns `false`. 它不藉由呼叫處理要求時，它可以再執行完全封鎖記憶體回收方法。It can then do a full blocking garbage collection when it's not handling requests by calling the method. > [!IMPORTANT] > 您無法巢狀呼叫方法，而且您應該只呼叫方法，如果執行階段目前處於無 GC 區域延遲模式。You cannot nest calls to the method, and you should only call the method if the runtime is currently in no GC region latency mode. 換句話說，您不應該呼叫多次 （第一個方法呼叫之後，後續呼叫將不會成功），和不應呼叫才會成功，因為第一次呼叫成功。In other words, you should not call multiple times (after the first method call, subsequent calls will not succeed), and you should not expect calls to to succeed just because the first call to succeeded. 您藉由呼叫結束無 GC 區域延遲模式方法。You exit the no GC region latency mode by calling the method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法會嘗試將記憶體回收行程中不允許記憶體回收，而應用程式執行的程式碼的重要區域無 GC 區域延遲模式。The method attempts to place the garbage collector in no GC region latency mode, which disallows garbage collection while an app executes a critical region of code. 如果執行階段無法一開始配置要求的記憶體數量，記憶體回收行程會執行完全封鎖記憶體回收，嘗試釋放出額外的記憶體。If the runtime is unable to initially allocate the requested amount of memory, the garbage collector performs a full blocking garbage collection in an attempt to free additional memory. 記憶體回收行程會進入無 GC 區域延遲模式，它是否能夠配置`lohSize`如 LOH 和`totalSize`–`lohSize`針對小物件堆積 (SOH)。The garbage collector enters no GC region latency mode if it is able to allocate `lohSize` for the LOH and `totalSize` – `lohSize` for the small object heap (SOH). `lohSize` 必須要夠大，無法處理 LOH，針對發生的關鍵路徑中的所有記憶體配置和`totalSize`–`lohSize`必須夠大，無法都處理的 SOH 中發生的關鍵路徑中的所有記憶體配置。`lohSize` must be large enough to handle all memory allocations that occur in the critical path for the LOH, and `totalSize` – `lohSize` must be large enough to handle all memory allocations that occur in the critical path for the SOH. 這包括應用程式時，所配置，以及執行階段可讓應用程式的代表的配置。This includes allocations by the app, as well as allocations that the runtime makes on the app's behalf. > [!IMPORTANT] > 您無法巢狀呼叫方法，而且您應該只呼叫方法，如果執行階段目前處於無 GC 區域延遲模式。You cannot nest calls to the method, and you should only call the method if the runtime is currently in no GC region latency mode. 換句話說，您不應該呼叫多次 （第一個方法呼叫之後，後續呼叫將不會成功），和不應呼叫才會成功，因為第一次呼叫成功。In other words, you should not call multiple times (after the first method call, subsequent calls will not succeed), and you should not expect calls to to succeed just because the first call to succeeded. 您藉由呼叫結束無 GC 區域延遲模式方法。You exit the no GC region latency mode by calling the method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法會嘗試將記憶體回收行程中不允許記憶體回收，而應用程式執行的程式碼的重要區域無 GC 區域延遲模式。The method attempts to place the garbage collector in no GC region latency mode, which disallows garbage collection while an app executes a critical region of code. 如果執行階段是無法一開始配置要求的記憶體數量和`disallowFullBlockingGC`引數是`false`，記憶體回收行程執行完全封鎖記憶體回收，嘗試釋放出額外的記憶體; 否則配置失敗，而且方法會傳回`false`。If the runtime is unable to initially allocate the requested amount of memory and the `disallowFullBlockingGC` argument is `false`, the garbage collector performs a full blocking garbage collection in an attempt to free additional memory; otherwise, the allocation fails, and the method returns `false`. 記憶體回收行程會進入無 GC 區域延遲模式，它是否能夠配置`lohSize`如 LOH 和`totalSize`–`lohSize`針對小物件堆積 (SOH)。The garbage collector enters no GC region latency mode if it is able to allocate `lohSize` for the LOH and `totalSize` – `lohSize` for the small object heap (SOH). `lohSize` 必須要夠大，無法處理 LOH，針對發生的關鍵路徑中的所有記憶體配置和`totalSize`–`lohSize`必須夠大，無法都處理的 SOH 中發生的關鍵路徑中的所有記憶體配置。`lohSize` must be large enough to handle all memory allocations that occur in the critical path for the LOH, and `totalSize` – `lohSize` must be large enough to handle all memory allocations that occur in the critical path for the SOH. 這包括應用程式時，所配置，以及執行階段可讓應用程式的代表的配置。This includes allocations by the app, as well as allocations that the runtime makes on the app's behalf. 設定`disallowFullBlockingGC`至`true`為了避免完整的封鎖記憶體回收集合，如果沒有足夠的記憶體一開始是負載平衡案例中最為有用： 一個系統可以呼叫這個方法，並報告本身為準備好接受要求，如果它傳回`true`，而且如果它傳回，將要求重新導向至其他系統的負載平衡器`false`。Setting `disallowFullBlockingGC` to `true` to prevent a full blocking garbage collection if not enough memory is initially available is most useful in load balancing scenarios: one system can call this method and report itself as ready to accept requests if it returns `true`, and have the load balancer redirect requests to other systems if it returns `false`. 它不藉由呼叫處理要求時，它可以再執行完全封鎖記憶體回收方法。It can then do a full blocking garbage collection when it's not handling requests by calling the method. > [!IMPORTANT] > 您無法巢狀呼叫方法，而且您應該只呼叫方法，如果執行階段目前處於無 GC 區域延遲模式。You cannot nest calls to the method, and you should only call the method if the runtime is currently in no GC region latency mode. 換句話說，您不應該呼叫多次 （第一個方法呼叫之後，後續呼叫將不會成功），和不應呼叫才會成功，因為第一次呼叫成功。In other words, you should not call multiple times (after the first method call, subsequent calls will not succeed), and you should not expect calls to to succeed just because the first call to succeeded. 您藉由呼叫結束無 GC 區域延遲模式方法。You exit the no GC region latency mode by calling the method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用來判斷目前記憶體回收通知的使用已註冊狀態，這個方法所傳回的列舉方法。Use the enumeration returned by this method to determine the status of the current garbage collection notification that was registered by using the method. 您也可以使用方法，以判斷是否已完成完整記憶體回收。You can also use the method to determine whether the full garbage collection has completed. 當列舉型別傳回，您可以執行工作，例如防止其他物件所配置和與自行引發集合方法。When the enumeration returns , you can do tasks such as preventing additional objects from being allocated and inducing a collection yourself with the method. 請注意通知並不保證，完整記憶體回收，就會發生，但是條件已達到是負責完整記憶體回收發生的臨界值。Note that the notification does not guarantee that a full garbage collection will occur, only that conditions have reached the threshold that are favorable for a full garbage collection to occur. 這個方法會無限期地等候取得記憶體回收通知。This method waits indefinitely for a garbage collection notification to be obtained. 如果您想要指定要傳回如果無法取得通知的方法逾時期間，使用方法多載。If you want to specify a time-out period for the method to return if the notification cannot be obtained, use the method overload. 如果您未指定逾時呼叫這個方法，您可以呼叫方法，如果您在慣用再等候。If you call this method without specifying a time-out, you can call the method if you are waiting longer than preferred. 您應該遵循此方法透過呼叫方法，確定您有完整記憶體回收。You should follow this method with a call to the method to make sure that you have had a full garbage collection. 單獨呼叫這個方法會造成未定的結果。Calling this method alone causes indeterminate results. ## Examples 下列範例會示範如何使用這個方法來判斷是否已接近完整的封鎖記憶體回收。The following example shows how to use this method to determine whether a full, blocking garbage collection is approaching. 每當通知的狀態是，使用者方法`OnFullGCApproachNotify`呼叫以執行動作以回應至接近的集合。Whenever the status of the notification is , the user method `OnFullGCApproachNotify` is called to perform actions in response to the approaching collection. 這個程式碼範例是針對所提供之較大範例的一部分[記憶體回收通知](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/notifications.md)主題。This code example is part of a larger example provided for [Garbage Collection Notifications](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/notifications.md) topic. summary.span: Suspends the current thread until the thread that is processing the queue of finalizers has emptied that queue.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 當記憶體回收行程會發現可以回收的物件時，它會檢查每個物件，以判斷物件的最終處理需求。When the garbage collector finds objects that can be reclaimed, it checks each object to determine the object's finalization requirements. 如果物件實作完成項且具有未停用最終處理藉由呼叫，該物件放在標示為準備進行最終處理物件的清單。If an object implements a finalizer and has not disabled finalization by calling , the object is placed in a list of objects that are marked as ready for finalization. 記憶體回收行程呼叫此清單中移除的項目從清單中物件的方法。The garbage collector calls the methods for the objects in this list and removes the entries from the list. 這個方法會封鎖直到所有的完成項已完成執行。This method blocks until all finalizers have run to completion. 完成項執行所在的執行緒未指定，因此不保證此方法將會終止。The thread on which finalizers are run is unspecified, so there is no guarantee that this method will terminate. 不過，這個執行緒可以會暫時中斷時的另一個執行緒方法正在進行中。However, this thread can be interrupted by another thread while the method is in progress. 例如，您可以啟動另一個執行緒等候一段時間，然後插斷這個執行緒，如果仍然暫止這個執行緒。For example, you can start another thread that waits for a period of time and then interrupts this thread if this thread is still suspended. ## Examples 下列範例示範如何使用暫停目前的執行緒，直到最終處理的所有收集到的物件已完成的方法。The following example demonstrates how to use the method to suspend the current thread until finalization of all the collected objects is complete. [!code-cpp[System.GC.WaitForPendingFinalizers Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.GC.WaitForPendingFinalizers Example/CPP/class1.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.GC.WaitForPendingFinalizers Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.GC.WaitForPendingFinalizers Example/CS/class1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.GC.WaitForPendingFinalizers Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.GC.WaitForPendingFinalizers Example/VB/class1.vb#1)]
